main_topic: Calculus: Limits, Derivatives, and Integrals with Applications to Physics
description: This series of educational videos will introduce first-year undergraduate students to the fundamental concepts of calculus, focusing on limits, derivatives, and integrals, and their applications in physics. The content is structured to build a solid foundation in calculus, leading to practical applications in physical scenarios.

subtopics.title: Introduction to Limits
subtopics.description: This subtopic introduces the concept of limits, defining what a limit is and why it is essential in calculus. Key concepts include approaching values, limit notation, and the idea of continuity. Examples will illustrate how to evaluate limits using direct substitution and simple algebraic manipulation.

subtopics.title: Calculating Limits: Techniques and Examples
subtopics.description: This video covers various techniques for calculating limits, including factoring, rationalizing, and using the Squeeze Theorem. It will also address common pitfalls and misconceptions when evaluating limits, with several worked examples to demonstrate each technique.

subtopics.title: Introduction to Derivatives
subtopics.description: This subtopic introduces derivatives, defining them as the rate of change of a function. It covers the concept of instantaneous rate of change and introduces derivative notation. Basic examples will illustrate how to interpret derivatives graphically.

subtopics.title: Basic Derivative Rules and Applications
subtopics.description: This video presents the basic rules for calculating derivatives, including the power rule, product rule, and quotient rule. It will also cover the concept of higher-order derivatives and provide examples of how derivatives are used in physics to describe motion.

subtopics.title: Introduction to Integrals
subtopics.description: This subtopic introduces integrals, defining them as the accumulation of quantities. It covers the concept of area under a curve and introduces integral notation. Simple examples will illustrate the relationship between integration and area.

subtopics.title: Fundamental Theorem of Calculus
subtopics.description: This video explains the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus, establishing the connection between differentiation and integration. It will cover both parts of the theorem, providing examples that demonstrate how to apply it to compute definite integrals.

subtopics.title: Applications of Derivatives in Physics
subtopics.description: This subtopic explores the applications of derivatives in physics, focusing on concepts such as velocity, acceleration, and optimization problems. It will include examples from kinematics and dynamics, illustrating how calculus is used to solve real-world physics problems.

subtopics.title: Applications of Integrals in Physics
subtopics.description: This final video discusses the applications of integrals in physics, including calculating work done by a force and finding the center of mass. It will provide complex examples that require the use of definite integrals, emphasizing the practical significance of integration in physical contexts.
